comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: This picture was used in The Day book., July 23, 1915, NOON EDITION, Image 23 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045487/1915-07-23/ed-... which reports that she is the daughter of W.G. Conrad, copper magnate of Montana. Her husband is described as a "Washington [DC] man" and they would make their home in the capital. Iron County record. (Cedar City, Utah), 13 Aug. 1915 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85058259/1915-08-13/ed-... also using the photo (with attribution to Harris & Ewing) gives her name as Minnie, and indicates that both families had property in Clark County, VA. The Washington herald. (Washington, D.C.), 21 Feb. 1911. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045433/1911-02-21/ed-... indicates that her mother (whose death is announced in the article) was the former Miss Nannie Bowen of Virginia.
